The light is reflected on the BC surface, according to the law of reflection, $\sin i_1 = n \sin r_1$. Where $n$ is the refractive index of the prism, $i_1$ and $r_1$ are the angles of incidence and refraction of this ray on the BC surface respectively.

The light undergoes total internal reflection on the AC surface, according to the law of reflection, $i_2 = r_2$. Where $i_2$ and $r_2$ are the angles of incidence and reflection of this ray on the AC surface respectively.

The light is refracted on the AB surface, according to the law of refraction, $n \sin i_3 = \sin r_3$. Where $i_3$ and $r_3$ are the angles of incidence and refraction of this ray on the AB surface respectively.
From geometric relationships, $i_2 = r_2 = 60^\circ, r_1 = i_3 = 30^\circ$.
The angle of deviation of the emerging light at point F relative to the incident light at point D is $\delta = (r_1 - i_1) + (180^\circ - i_2 - r_2) + (r_3 - i_3)$, $\delta = 60^\circ$.
